channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-13376] Multi-node race condition to create/remove nodeLost markers
item.description:
NodeMarkersRegistrationTest.testNodeMarkersRegistration is frequently failing on jenkins builds in the same spot, with a similar looking logs.

Although i haven't been able to reproduce these failures locally, I am fairly confident that the problem is a race condition bug that exists between when/how a new Overseer will process & clean up "nodeLost" marker's in ZK, with how other nodes may (mistakenly) re-create those markers in their liveNodes listener.
item.summary: Multi-node race condition to create/remove nodeLost markers

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Here's a snippet from a recent jenkins failure showing (most of) the various log messages related to killing the current overseer (127.0.0.1:34439_solr) and the election of the new overseer (127.0.0.1:60799_solr) which starts trying to process & clean up the nodeLost marker (from the old overseer we just killed) ...

   [junit4]   2> 4182560 INFO  (TEST-NodeMarkersRegistrationTest.testNodeMarkersRegistration-seed#[CEF36F7B98862002]) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.NodeMarkersRegistrationTest ====== KILL OVERSEER 1
   [junit4]   2> 4182560 INFO  (TEST-NodeMarkersRegistrationTest.testNodeMarkersRegistration-seed#[CEF36F7B98862002]) [    ] o.a.s.c.CoreContainer Shutting down CoreContainer instance=1405900886
   [junit4]   2> 4182560 INFO  (TEST-NodeMarkersRegistrationTest.testNodeMarkersRegistration-seed#[CEF36F7B98862002]) [    ] o.a.s.c.ZkController Remove node as live in ZooKeeper:/live_nodes/127.0.0.1:34439_solr
   [junit4]   2> 4182562 INFO  (TEST-NodeMarkersRegistrationTest.testNodeMarkersRegistration-seed#[CEF36F7B98862002]) [    ] o.a.s.c.CoreContainer Publish this node as DOWN...
   [junit4]   2> 4182562 INFO  (TEST-NodeMarkersRegistrationTest.testNodeMarkersRegistration-seed#[CEF36F7B98862002]) [    ] o.a.s.c.ZkController Publish node=127.0.0.1:34439_solr as DOWN
...
   [junit4]   2> 4182597 INFO  (closeThreadPool-22866-thread-2) [    ] o.a.s.c.Overseer Overseer (id=72361782412836870-127.0.0.1:34439_solr-n_0000000000) closing
   [junit4]   2> 4182597 INFO  (OverseerStateUpdate-72361782412836870-127.0.0.1:34439_solr-n_0000000000) [n:127.0.0.1:34439_solr    ] o.a.s.c.Overseer Overseer Loop exiting : 127.0.0.1:34439_solr
   [junit4]   2> 4182608 INFO  (OverseerAutoScalingTriggerThread-72361782412836870-127.0.0.1:34439_solr-n_0000000000) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.OverseerTriggerThread OverseerTriggerThread woken up but we are closed, exiting.
   [junit4]   2> 4182616 INFO  (zkCallback-22830-thread-2) [    ] o.a.s.c.c.ZkStateReader Updated live nodes from ZooKeeper... (3) -> (2)
   [junit4]   2> 4182616 INFO  (zkCallback-22830-thread-1) [    ] o.a.s.c.OverseerElectionContext I am going to be the leader 127.0.0.1:60799_solr
   [junit4]   2> 4182616 INFO  (zkCallback-22837-thread-1) [    ] o.a.s.c.c.ZkStateReader Updated live nodes from ZooKeeper... (3) -> (2)
   [junit4]   2> 4182616 INFO  (zkCallback-22861-thread-1) [    ] o.a.s.c.c.ZkStateReader Updated live nodes from ZooKeeper... (3) -> (2)
   [junit4]   2> 4182617 INFO  (zkCallback-22830-thread-1) [n:127.0.0.1:60799_solr    ] o.a.s.c.Overseer Overseer (id=72361782412836873-127.0.0.1:60799_solr-n_0000000001) starting
   [junit4]   2> 4182623 INFO  (OverseerStateUpdate-72361782412836873-127.0.0.1:60799_solr-n_0000000001) [n:127.0.0.1:60799_solr    ] o.a.s.c.Overseer Starting to work on the main queue : 127.0.0.1:60799_solr
   [junit4]   2> 4182624 DEBUG (OverseerAutoScalingTriggerThread-72361782412836873-127.0.0.1:60799_solr-n_0000000001) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.OverseerTriggerThread Refreshing /autoscaling.json with znode version 2
   [junit4]   2> 4182624 DEBUG (OverseerAutoScalingTriggerThread-72361782412836873-127.0.0.1:60799_solr-n_0000000001) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.OverseerTriggerThread Current znodeVersion 2, lastZnodeVersion 0
   [junit4]   2> 4182624 DEBUG (OverseerAutoScalingTriggerThread-72361782412836873-127.0.0.1:60799_solr-n_0000000001) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.OverseerTriggerThread Processed trigger updates upto znodeVersion 2
   [junit4]   2> 4182625 DEBUG (OverseerAutoScalingTriggerThread-72361782412836873-127.0.0.1:60799_solr-n_0000000001) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.NodeLostTrigger NodeLostTrigger .auto_add_replicas - Initial livenodes: [127.0.0.1:34504_solr, 127.0.0.1:60799_solr]
   [junit4]   2> 4182625 DEBUG (OverseerAutoScalingTriggerThread-72361782412836873-127.0.0.1:60799_solr-n_0000000001) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.NodeLostTrigger Adding lost node from marker path: 127.0.0.1:34439_solr
   [junit4]   2> 4182625 DEBUG (OverseerAutoScalingTriggerThread-72361782412836873-127.0.0.1:60799_solr-n_0000000001) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.OverseerTriggerThread -- cleaning old nodeLost / nodeAdded markers
   [junit4]   2> 4182647 INFO  (zkCallback-22843-thread-1) [    ] o.a.s.c.c.ZkStateReader Updated live nodes from ZooKeeper... (3) -> (2)
   [junit4]   2> 4182647 DEBUG (closeThreadPool-22866-thread-2) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.ScheduledTriggers Shutting down scheduled thread pool executor now
   [junit4]   2> 4182648 INFO  (zkCallback-22854-thread-1) [    ] o.a.s.c.c.ZkStateReader Updated live nodes from ZooKeeper... (3) -> (2)
   [junit4]   2> 4182648 DEBUG (OverseerAutoScalingTriggerThread-72361782412836873-127.0.0.1:60799_solr-n_0000000001) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.OverseerTriggerThread Current znodeVersion 2, lastZnodeVersion 2
   [junit4]   2> 4182649 DEBUG (ScheduledTrigger-16420-thread-1) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.NodeLostTrigger Running NodeLostTrigger: .auto_add_replicas with currently live nodes: 2 and last live nodes: 2
   [junit4]   2> 4182649 DEBUG (ScheduledTrigger-16420-thread-1) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.NodeLostTrigger Tracking lost node: 127.0.0.1:34439_solr
   [junit4]   2> 4182649 DEBUG (closeThreadPool-22866-thread-2) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.ScheduledTriggers Shutting down action executor now
   [junit4]   2> 4182649 DEBUG (closeThreadPool-22866-thread-2) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.ScheduledTriggers Awaiting termination for action executor
   [junit4]   2> 4182649 DEBUG (closeThreadPool-22866-thread-2) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.ScheduledTriggers Awaiting termination for scheduled thread pool executor
   [junit4]   2> 4182649 DEBUG (closeThreadPool-22866-thread-2) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.ScheduledTriggers ScheduledTriggers closed completely
   [junit4]   2> 4182649 DEBUG (closeThreadPool-22866-thread-2) [    ] o.a.s.c.a.OverseerTriggerThread OverseerTriggerThread has been closed explicitly
   [junit4]   2> 4182649 INFO  (TEST-NodeMarkersRegistrationTest.testNodeMarkersRegistration-seed#[CEF36F7B98862002]) [    ] o.a.s.c.Overseer Overseer (id=72361782412836870-127.0.0.1:34439_solr-n_0000000000) closing
   [junit4]   2> 4182650 INFO  (closeThreadPool-22866-thread-1) [    ] o.a.s.c.Overseer Overseer (id=72361782412836870-127.0.0.1:34439_solr-n_0000000000) closing
   [junit4]   2> 4182658 INFO  (TEST-NodeMarkersRegistrationTest.testNodeMarkersRegistration-seed#[CEF36F7B98862002]) [    ] o.e.j.s.AbstractConnector Stopped ServerConnector@5225529d{HTTP/1.1,[http/1.1, h2c]}{127.0.0.1:0}
   [junit4]   2> 4182707 INFO  (TEST-NodeMarkersRegistrationTest.testNodeMarkersRegistration-seed#[CEF36F7B98862002]) [    ] o.e.j.s.h.ContextHandler Stopped o.e.j.s.ServletContextHandler@65496f5d{/solr,null,UNAVAILABLE}
...

Note in particular that the OverseerTriggerThread does it's "cleaning old nodeLost" markers @ 4182625, and then after that there are still 2 zkCallback threads that "Updated live nodes from ZooKeeper" @ 4182647 (In addition to a few zkCallback threads that updated live nodes @ 4182616 before the OverseerTriggerThread kicks off).

In all the jenkins failures i've seen, the basic pattern holds up...

  1. Old overseer is killed
  2. Some number of zkCallback threads say "Updated live nodes from ZooKeeper... (3) -> (2)"
  3. New overseer trigger thread says "cleaning old nodeLost..."
  4. at least one zkCallback thread says "Updated live nodes from ZooKeeper... (3) -> (2)"

...meanwhile, in all the successful (local) runs I've looked at...

  1. Old overseer is killed
  2. All zkCallback threads say "Updated live nodes from ZooKeeper... (3) -> (2)"
  3. New overseer trigger thread says "cleaning old nodeLost..."

The code in ZkController.registerLiveNodesListener shows that when the live nodes callback listener is run, any node (overseer or otherwise) may add a nodeLost marker path for any removed node (oddly: as long as it's one of the first "3" nodes listed?) ... And as we can see from the logs above, this can happen after the OverseerTriggerThread does it's cleanup, and it won't attempt any more cleanup of markers unless/until the autoscaling config is updated.

Hmm, indeed there's a race condition here.

The reason for having more than 1 node attempt creating a nodeLost marker is that more than 1 node may go away (3 was a magic number that we felt wasn't excessive and still reduced the chance of losing the event due to multiple node failures).

This cleaning of leftover markers in OverseerTriggerThread was added early on when we added this functionality, and it may not be necessary anymore - there's InactiveMarkersPlanAction that runs periodically to remove stale markers.

This cleaning of leftover markers in OverseerTriggerThread was added early on when we added this functionality, and it may not be necessary anymore - there's InactiveMarkersPlanAction that runs periodically to remove stale markers.

If this test doesn't reflect reality, and it's expected that InactiveMarkersPlanAction is what will clean up the markers, then the test needs fixed – because right now it (like many other auto-scalling tests) goes out of it's way to disable the .scheduled_maintenance trigger.

For the record, this is the exact question I asked you about when you first resolved SOLR-13072 (but initially left this test marked AwaitsFix), but you never replied .. you just re-enabled the test (w/o any modifications to it) and re-resolved this issue...

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SOLR-13072?focusedCommentId=16732499&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-16732499

Also: AFAICT there is nothing in the ref-guide that mentions the .scheduled_maintenance trigger, or any of it's (default) actions (inactive_shard_plan, inactive_markers_plan, execute_plan) or what they due, or why they (may) be important for cleaning up things like the nodeLost/nodeAdded markers.  that seems like a problematic omission?

Commit deb79872720fbaffa138ab4ef3c7226bec935aaf in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/branch_8x from Chris M. Hostetter
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=deb7987 ]

SOLR-13376: Disable test until it can be re-written to reflect actual expected behavior of how/when node markers will be cleaned up

(cherry picked from commit ab55b6386b701ec91afb92b269decd081f398ca8)

Commit ab55b6386b701ec91afb92b269decd081f398ca8 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/master from Chris M. Hostetter
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=ab55b63 ]

SOLR-13376: Disable test until it can be re-written to reflect actual expected behavior of how/when node markers will be cleaned up

it's expected that InactiveMarkersPlanAction is what will clean up the markers

It's expected to eventually clean them - the trigger runs once a day. That's why the section in OverseerTriggerThread.run() was removing them on overseer leader change, to clean the markers that we know for sure are no longer needed. And apparently this creates the race condition.

you just re-enabled the test (w/o any modifications to it) and re-resolved this issue

Well, for the record, see 1cfbd3e1c84d35e741cfc068a8e88f0eff4ea9e1 where I tried to address another source of the test's instability, and the test's reliability improved after that change. The race condition that you discovered is something new that I wasn't aware of before, so I'm going to fix it (and add the missing documentation on .scheduled_maintenance trigger).

Commit ab55b6386b701ec91afb92b269decd081f398ca8 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/jira/LUCENE-8738 from Chris M. Hostetter
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=ab55b63 ]

SOLR-13376: Disable test until it can be re-written to reflect actual expected behavior of how/when node markers will be cleaned up

hossman - this patch changes the OverseerTriggerThread so that it does not remove markers once it's done init-ing all triggers, only marks them "inactive". This kills two birds with one stone - it prevents straggler nodes from re-creating these markers, and it allows triggers to avoid processing them multiple times (on multiple Overseer leader changes). It also speeds up removal of markers in InactiveMarkersPlanAction.

I also added some Ref Guide documentation about the maintenance trigger. I'd appreciate a review.

Commit 8c144444fe3f71e5a5131432b1285ebff518ccb0 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/master from Andrzej Bialecki
